fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components

Class AsynchronousCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components.AsynchronousCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI

    public class AsynchronousCalculator
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
    The class AsynchronousCalculator implements a calculator component which rather than being called synchronously and returning a result as usual, services are called asynchronously and send their result through a specific reception interface using a port URI passed as parameters.

    Description

    For those who have been exposed to this kind of things, the use of a method call at the end of the service to send back the result is comparable to a form of continuation-passing style.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2020-05-05

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • addition

        public void addition(double x,
                     double y,
                     long serialNo,
                     java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        add the two first parameter and return the result by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial number allows the caller to identify its call when receiving the result.

        Contract

         pre    resultReceptionInboundPortURI != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        x - first operand.
        y - first operand.
        serialNo - serial number of the call.
        resultReceptionInboundPortURI - URI of the port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI to return the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
